DocTemplateDefinition.Name: Actor Assignment
DocTemplateDefinition.Documentation: Actors may have assignments indicating objects for which they have responsibility. An example of such assignment is a work order assigned to an organization.

DocTemplateDefinition.Name: Assignment to Group
DocTemplateDefinition.Documentation:
The _Assignment to Group_ established the assignment of an object to a group, being an arbitrary collection of objects. It is the complementary concept template to _Group Assignment_ defining how object are assigned by a group.
The grouping relationship does not apply any other meaning then grouping objects under some aspect. It is non-hierarchical, meaning that objects can be assigned to many groups, and it does not interfere with other relationship concepts, such as _Element Decomposition_.

DocLocalization.Name: AUTOMATIC
DocLocalization.Documentation: <TemplateRules operator="and"> <!-- Check assignement to IfcDistributionSystem --> <TemplateRule Parameters="IsAssigned[Size]>0 AND SystemName[Value]='WWS_1'"/> </TemplateRules>

DocLocalization.Name: AUTOMATIC
DocLocalization.Documentation: <TemplateRules operator="and"> <!-- Check assignement to IfcDistributionSystem --> <TemplateRule Parameters="IsAssigned[Size]>0 AND SystemName[Value]='WWS_1'"/> </TemplateRules>

DocTemplateDefinition.Name: Control Assignment
DocTemplateDefinition.Documentation: Controls may have assignments indicating objects that must observe the established requirements. An example of such assignment is a labor resource assigned to a calendar.

DocTemplateDefinition.Name: Group Assignment
DocTemplateDefinition.Documentation:
_Group Assignment_ established an arbitrary collection of objects within a group. The grouping relationship does not apply any other meaning then grouping objects under some aspect. It is non-hierarchical, that is objects can be grouped into different logical groups, and it does not interfere with other relationship concepts, such as _ObjectAggregation_.
The _Group Assignment_ concept establish a given object as being the group collection for other objects. An _IfcZone_ is a specific group object for collecting spaces, _IfcDistributionSystem_ is a specific group object for collecting distribution elements. Usually a grouping relationship is applied to group elements for a particular purpose or function. It usually implies the existence of a grouping relationship and the provision of some identity under which the group is characterized.
* Group collection is handled by an instance of _IfcRelAssignsToGroup_, which assigns all group members to the _IfcGroup_ being the collection. * Objects included in group as collected items are linked by _IsGroupedBy_ pointing to _IfcRelAssignsToGroup_
> NOTE  The _IfcGroup_ maybe not yet have a grouping relationship established, it then identifies an empty group.
> EXAMPLE  An air handler belonging to an air conditioning system is an example of such group assignment.

DocTemplateDefinition.Name: Process Assignment
DocTemplateDefinition.Documentation: Processes may have assignments indicating resources consumed or occupied by the process. An example of such assignment is a carpenter labor resource building a wall.

DocTemplateDefinition.Name: Process Type Assignment
DocTemplateDefinition.Documentation: Process types may have assignments indicating re-usable resource types for which occurrences may be consumed or occupied by occurrences of the process type. An example of such assignment is a concrete mixer resource type for delivering concrete.

DocTemplateDefinition.Name: Product Assignment
DocTemplateDefinition.Documentation: Products may have assignments indicating processes that operate upon the product. An example of such assignment is a task to construct a wall.

DocTemplateDefinition.Name: Product Type Assignment
DocTemplateDefinition.Documentation: Product types may have assignments indicating re-usable process types for which occurrences may operate on occurrences of the product type. An example of such assignment is a task type for placing concrete in slabs on grade.

DocTemplateDefinition.Name: Resource Assignment
DocTemplateDefinition.Documentation: Resources may have assignments indicating sources available to be used. An example of such assignment is a person fulfilling a carpenter labor resource.

DocTemplateDefinition.Name: Resource Type Assignment
DocTemplateDefinition.Documentation: Resource types may have assignments indicating re-usable product types for which occurrences may be sourced by occurrences of the resource type. An example of such assignment is a particular crane model that may be used for a crane equipment resource used for erecting steel.
